guide.introduction: BEAM bots are usually known as trimmets or photovores, but I have made up my own that is called a flimmet. Here are some step by step instructions on how to build one. The flimmet is quite fast if a lot of sunlight hits the solar cell.
guide.introduction_rendered:
BEAM bots are usually known as trimmets or photovores, but I have made up my own that is called a flimmet. Here are some step by step instructions on how to build one. The flimmet is quite fast if a lot of sunlight hits the solar cell.

Relevant parts
  • 1 Solar Cell, 1 Page Motor, 2 Resistors, 1 Capacitor, and 2 LEDs.
Tools
  • Soldering Iron, Pliers, and a Hot glue gun.

parts.text: 1 Solar Cell, 1 Page Motor, 2 Resistors, 1 Capacitor, and 2 LEDs.

steps.title: Solder two LEDs together, and then solder some wire to the LEDs.
Next solder the two resistors together.
Now solder the resistors to the LED wire.
Solder the capacitor to the pager motor.
now dab the hot glue guns tip on the end of the pager motor
make sure you can solder on the motor.
solder some wire to the motor.
now solder the motor wire to the middle of the resistors.
Next solder two bits of wire to the ends of the capacitor.
finally solder the two bits of wire two the solar cell.
Now put your FLIMMET in the sun and watch it move along.
